articles.author: By Christopher Stevens for the Daily Mail
articles.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Geoffrey Palmer, doyen of TV husbands, dies aged 93 - Daily Mail
articles.description: Geoffrey Palmer, pictured with his wife Sally Green, was one of Britain's biggest stars in the 1970s, starring across from Wendy Craig in Butterflies, and later opposite Judi Dench.
articles.content:
With his drooping jowls and heavy eyes, a liverish glow suffusing his cheeks, Geoffrey Palmer was the archetypal long-suffering husband.
The actor, who has died peacefully at home aged 93, was famou… [+5010 chars]

articles.title: The Mandalorian Spiders Explained: Krykna and Star Wars Movie Connections - Den of Geek
articles.description: The Mandalorian season 2's latest episode, "The Passenger," is not for arachnophobes. But if you can sit through giant spiders crawling all over your screen, here's what you need to know about the show's newest predator.
articles.content: Unsurprisingly, this immediately pisses off the rest of the spiders in the nest, who begin swarming the cave and hatching out of the other eggs. Leading the charge is a massive spider queen, who, lik… [+2264 chars]

articles.author: Sam Elliott
articles.title: Three Radio One DJs axed in huge shake-up to make way for fresh new talent - Mirror Online
articles.description: Dev Griffin, Huw Stephens and Phil Taggart will all leave the BBC's flagship station as five new presenters are set to join in the New Year, Radio One bosses have said
articles.content:
The BBC have confirmed the axe has fallen on three DJs after a huge shake-up at Radio One.
The corporation has announced the changes will kick in from January 4.
